0-7.8-2.2-7.7-4.4z"/>
<path fill="#AADCE6" d="M83 30c0-13-5.1-16.9-13-16.9-9 0-15 6.2-15 16.4 0 10.5 5.5 16.2 15.8 16.2 5.6 0 9.8-2.7 11.2-4.7v-3c-2.1.7-3.9 1.2-7.8 1.2-5.4 0-9.2-3.2-9.2-9.2h18zM69.9 16.6c2.5 0 3.8 1.9 3.8 9.6l-8.4.5c.2-7.9 1.8-10.1 4.6-10.1zM37 45v-3l-3-1.5V21c1.2-.9 3.3-1.7 4.8-1.7 2.8 0 4.3 1.5 4.2 4.2v17L40 42v3h16v-3l-3-1.5v-19c0-5.7-3.3-8.3-7.7-8.3-4.1 0-8.6 1.3-11.3 3.8V0h-1L21 2v3l4 1.5v34L22 42v3h15zM4 36.4c0 5.7 2.8 9.3 8.9 9.3 3.1 0 6.5-.8 8.4-2.3v-3.8c-.8.3-2.2.5-3.3.5-2.9 0-4-1.6-4-4.6V19h7v-5h-7V6.5L4 8v6l-4 1v4h4v17.4z"/>
</svg>
</span>
</a>

<article id="article" data-test-id="article-root" class="content content--article section-world-news tonal tonal--tone-news" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/NewsArticle" role="main">
<meta itemprop="mainEntityOfPage" content="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/oct/25/protest-after-western-media-troublemakers-barred-from-xi-jinping-speech">
<div itemprop="publisher" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/Organization">
<meta itemprop="name" content="The Guardian">
<div itemprop="logo" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
<meta itemprop="url" content="https://static.guim.co.uk/sys-images/Guardian/Pix/pictures/2015/10/1/1443713974413/Guardiantitlepiecedigitalon.png">
<meta itemprop="width" content="300">
<meta itemprop="height" content="60">
</div>

<header class="content__head tonal__head tonal__head--tone-news
    
    ">
<div class="content__header tonal__header">
<div class="gs-container">
<div class="content__main-column u-cf">
<div class="content__labels content__labels--not-immersive
">
</div>
<h1 class="content__headline" itemprop="headline">
Protest after Western media 'troublemakers' barred from Xi Jinping speech
</h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="tonal__standfirst u-cf">
<div class="gs-container">
<div class="content__main-column">
<div class="content__standfirst" data-link-name="standfirst" data-component="standfirst">
<meta itemprop="description" content="BBC, the Financial Times, the New York Times and the Guardian all refused access to unveiling of new politburo"/>
<p>BBC, the Financial Times, the New York Times and the Guardian all refused access to unveiling of new politburo</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</header>
<div class="content__main tonal__main tonal__main--tone-news">
<div class="gs-container">
<div class="content__main-column content__main-column--article js-content-main-column ">
<div class="js-score"></div>
<div class="js-sport-tabs football-tabs content__mobile-full-width"></div>
<figure itemprop="associatedMedia image" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject" data-component="image" class="media-primary media-content()  " data-media-id="1b85243ab3c53b650a579a6f06817e8be6dad8ac" id="img-1">
<meta itemprop="representativeOfPage" content="true">

<meta itemprop="width" content="4811">
<meta itemprop="height" content="2886">

</svg>
</span>
</label>

</svg>
</span>
Chinese President Xi Jinping speaks as he introduces the Communist Party of China’s new Politburo Standing Committee, the nation’s top decision-making body.

</figcaption>
</figure>

</a>
</li>
<li class="social__item social__item--messenger social--hidden social__secondary" data-link-name="messenger">
<a class="social__action js-social__action--top social-icon-wrapper" data-link-name="social top" href="fb-messenger://share?link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fworld%2F2017%2Foct%2F25%2Fprotest-after-western-media-troublemakers-barred-from-xi-jinping-speech%3FCMP%3Dshare_btn_me&amp;app_id=180444840287" target="_blank" title="Messenger">
<span class=' u-h '>Share on Messenger</span>
<span class="inline-share-messenger inline-icon rounded-icon centered-icon social-icon social-icon--messenger">
<svg width="66" height="66" viewbox="-12 -12 90 90" class="rounded-icon__svg centered-icon__svg social-icon__svg social-icon--messenger__svg inline-share-messenger__svg inline-icon__svg">
<path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M33 61.1c-3.6 0-7.1-.5-10.4-1.5L10.1 66V52.5C3.9 47 0 39.2 0 30.6 0 13.7 14.8 0 33 0s33 13.7 33 30.6c0 16.8-14.8 30.5-33 30.5zM36.5 41L28 32.2l-16.4 9 18-18.9 8.5 8.8 16.4-9-18 18.9z"/>
</svg>
</span>
</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<p class="byline" data-link-name="byline" data-component="meta-byline"><span itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemprop="author">
<a rel="author" class="tone-colour" itemprop="sameAs" data-link-name="auto tag link" href="https://www.theguardian.com/profile/tomphillips"><span itemprop="name">Tom Phillips</span></a></span> in Beijing</p>
<p class="content__dateline" aria-hidden="true">
<time itemprop="datePublished" datetime='2017-10-25T13:18:16+0100' data-timestamp="1508933896000" class="content__dateline-wpd js-wpd">
Wednesday 25 October 2017 <span class="content__dateline-time">13.18 BST</span>
</time>
<time datetime='2017-10-25T06:08:45+0100' data-timestamp="1508908125000" class="content__dateline-lm js-lm u-h">
First published on Wednesday 25 October 2017 <span class="content__dateline-time">06.08 BST</span>
</time>
</p>
<meta itemprop="dateModified" content="2017-10-25T22:00:11+0100">
</div>
<div class="content__article-body from-content-api js-article__body" itemprop="articleBody" data-test-id="article-review-body">
<p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/china" data-link-name="auto-linked-tag" data-component="auto-linked-tag" class="u-underline">China</a> has trumpeted this week’s pomp-filled Communist party congress as an example of its increasing openness and transparency.<br></p>
<p>But a number of major western news organisations whose coverage has irked Beijing were excluded from Xi Jinping’s <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/oct/25/the-seven-men-who-make-up-chinas-new-politburo-xi-jinping" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">unveiling of China’s new ruling council</a> on Wednesday – in some cases for the first time in more than two decades. </p>
<aside class="element element-rich-link element--thumbnail element-rich-link--not-upgraded" data-component="rich-link" data-link-name="rich-link-2 | 1">
<p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/oct/25/xi-jinping-signals-intent-power-successor-politburo-china" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">Xi Jinping signals intent to remain in power by revealing politburo with no successor</a> </p>
</aside>
<p>Those refused access to Xi’s statement to the media include the BBC, the Financial Times, the Economist, the New York Times and the Guardian. Chinese officials offered no formal explanation for the decision. <br></p>
<p>The Daily Telegraph, which regularly publishes Communist party propaganda in the UK as part of <a href="https://twitter.com/MrRFH/status/921995789328453632" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">a reported £800,000 annual contract</a> with Beijing’s China Daily, is understood to have been granted an invitation to Xi’s event.</p>
<div class="amp-ad-container">
<amp-ad width="300" height="250" type="doubleclick" data-loading-strategy="prefer-viewability-over-views" json="{&quot;targeting&quot;:{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/world/2017/oct/25/protest-after-western-media-troublemakers-barred-from-xi-jinping-speech&quot;,&quot;edition&quot;:&quot;int&quot;,&quot;se&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;ct&quot;:&quot;Article&quot;,&quot;p&quot;:&quot;amp&quot;,&quot;keywordIds&quot;:&quot;world/china,world/xi-jinping,world/asia-pacific,world/world,media/media&quot;,&quot;k&quot;:&quot;china,xi-jinping,asia-pacific,world,media&quot;,&quot;co&quot;:&quot;tomphillips&quot;,&quot;bl&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;authorIds&quot;:&quot;profile/tomphillips&quot;,&quot;section&quot;:&quot;world&quot;}}" data-slot="/59666047/theguardian.com/world/Some(article)/amp">
</amp-ad>
</div>
<p>In a statement, the Foreign Correspondents Club of China (FCCC) said it was concerned about the exclusions.</p>
<p>“The press conference is a high profile news event involving China’s top leadership and it is hard to avoid the conclusion that these media organisations have been singled out to send a message,” it said. </p>
<p>“Using media access as a tool to punish journalists whose coverage the Chinese authorities disapprove of is a gross violation of the principles of press freedom,” the group added.</p>
<p>Qiao Mu, a former journalism professor at Beijing Foreign Studies University <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/sep/14/qiao-mu-dissenting-academic-leaves-china-for-us" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">who recently went into self-imposed exile in the United States</a>, said China appeared to have barred those it considered “trouble makers”. The move reflected the frustration of Chinese officials at Xi’s inability to “control the tone of the western media”. <br></p>
<p>“The situation will get worse ... more and more western media websites will be blocked, and journalists will be expelled or [find it] hard to get visas,” Qiao added. He said that in Xi’s “new era” there was room for only “one voice”. <br></p>
<div class="amp-ad-container">
<amp-ad width="300" height="250" type="doubleclick" data-loading-strategy="prefer-viewability-over-views" json="{&quot;targeting&quot;:{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/world/2017/oct/25/protest-after-western-media-troublemakers-barred-from-xi-jinping-speech&quot;,&quot;edition&quot;:&quot;int&quot;,&quot;se&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;ct&quot;:&quot;Article&quot;,&quot;p&quot;:&quot;amp&quot;,&quot;keywordIds&quot;:&quot;world/china,world/xi-jinping,world/asia-pacific,world/world,media/media&quot;,&quot;k&quot;:&quot;china,xi-jinping,asia-pacific,world,media&quot;,&quot;co&quot;:&quot;tomphillips&quot;,&quot;bl&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;authorIds&quot;:&quot;profile/tomphillips&quot;,&quot;section&quot;:&quot;world&quot;}}" data-slot="/59666047/theguardian.com/world/Some(article)/amp">
</amp-ad>
</div>
<p>In his address to handpicked journalists on Wednesday, Xi said: “The party congress has received extensive and detailed reporting from our friends in the press, with many of you coming from afar. You have worked very hard and your media coverage has captured the attention of the world. I want to say a big thank you to you all.”</p>
<p>However, he also issued a thinly-veiled rebuke to foreign journalists who publish reports that question the party line. </p>
<aside class="element element-rich-link element--thumbnail element-rich-link--not-upgraded" data-component="rich-link" data-link-name="rich-link-2 | 2">
<p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/oct/25/the-seven-men-who-make-up-chinas-new-politburo-xi-jinping" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">The omnipotent seven: meet the men who make up China's new politburo</a> </p>
</aside>
<p>“We do not need lavish praise from others. However, we do welcome objective reporting and constructive suggestions.”</p>
<p>Xi borrowed the words of Yuan dynasty poet, Wang Mian, to hammer his point home: “Not angling for compliments, I would be content that my integrity fills the universe.”<br></p>
<p>Beijing has attempted to contrast its supposedly open congress with Donald Trump’s hostility towards the media.</p>
<div class="amp-ad-container">
<amp-ad width="300" height="250" type="doubleclick" data-loading-strategy="prefer-viewability-over-views" json="{&quot;targeting&quot;:{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/world/2017/oct/25/protest-after-western-media-troublemakers-barred-from-xi-jinping-speech&quot;,&quot;edition&quot;:&quot;int&quot;,&quot;se&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;ct&quot;:&quot;Article&quot;,&quot;p&quot;:&quot;amp&quot;,&quot;keywordIds&quot;:&quot;world/china,world/xi-jinping,world/asia-pacific,world/world,media/media&quot;,&quot;k&quot;:&quot;china,xi-jinping,asia-pacific,world,media&quot;,&quot;co&quot;:&quot;tomphillips&quot;,&quot;bl&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;authorIds&quot;:&quot;profile/tomphillips&quot;,&quot;section&quot;:&quot;world&quot;}}" data-slot="/59666047/theguardian.com/world/Some(article)/amp">
</amp-ad>
</div>
<p>“The Party congress has become more open and transparent, which reflects the growing confidence of the ruling party of a large country like China,” Dong Guanpeng, the head of the media and public relations institute at the Communication University of China told Xinhua, China’s official news agency.</p>
<p>A series of <a href="https://www.apnews.com/c27a3db894014551b83e104b75ad65eb" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">heavily scripted “press conferences</a>” have been organised, which were attended by a large number of foreign reporters on the payroll of party-run media outlets. Many of the questions appeared to have been pre-screened. <br></p>
<p> “There is great access and openness at the Party congress, whereas in the United States, the administration is closed in a way that they don’t want media attention or criticism,” Xinhua quoted an American journalist, Sarah Wendt, as saying. <br></p>
<p>According to her Twitter profile Wendt works for <a href="http://www.sinovision.net/" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">Sinovision</a>, a US-based television channel with ties to China’s party-run CCTV and which describes itself as “the leading and most dominant Chinese-language TV station in the Metropolitan New York area”.</p>
<div class="amp-ad-container">
<amp-ad width="300" height="250" type="doubleclick" data-loading-strategy="prefer-viewability-over-views" json="{&quot;targeting&quot;:{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/world/2017/oct/25/protest-after-western-media-troublemakers-barred-from-xi-jinping-speech&quot;,&quot;edition&quot;:&quot;int&quot;,&quot;se&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;ct&quot;:&quot;Article&quot;,&quot;p&quot;:&quot;amp&quot;,&quot;keywordIds&quot;:&quot;world/china,world/xi-jinping,world/asia-pacific,world/world,media/media&quot;,&quot;k&quot;:&quot;china,xi-jinping,asia-pacific,world,media&quot;,&quot;co&quot;:&quot;tomphillips&quot;,&quot;bl&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;authorIds&quot;:&quot;profile/tomphillips&quot;,&quot;section&quot;:&quot;world&quot;}}" data-slot="/59666047/theguardian.com/world/Some(article)/amp">
</amp-ad>
</div>
<p>China-based correspondents say the treatment of foreign journalists <a draggable="true" href="https://www.theguardian.com/media/greenslade/2016/nov/15/foreign-journalists-working-in-china-face-increased-harassment" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">appears to have deteriorated</a> since Xi took power in 2012 and began a wide-ranging crackdown on opposition voices. <br tabindex="-1"></p>
<p>Last week the Global Times, a party-controlled tabloid, accused the western media of “misleading” and “incorrect” coverage of China. <br></p>
<p>“[Some] Western journalists do not show professionalism in their coverage and their reporting remains ideologically superficial and does not get the gist of China’s new era,” <a href="http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/1071241.shtml" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">it claimed</a>. <br></p>
<p>Asked about the exclusions, China’s foreign ministry spokesman, Geng Shuang, said: “What I can tell you is that we welcome foreign journalists to interview and report on the 19th party congress and handle foreign journalists’ applications according to laws and regulations.”</p>
<p>In a statement to AFP the congress’ media centre said it had “tried [its] best to allow more foreign journalists to attend this event”. </p>
<div class="amp-ad-container">
<amp-ad width="300" height="250" type="doubleclick" data-loading-strategy="prefer-viewability-over-views" json="{&quot;targeting&quot;:{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/world/2017/oct/25/protest-after-western-media-troublemakers-barred-from-xi-jinping-speech&quot;,&quot;edition&quot;:&quot;int&quot;,&quot;se&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;ct&quot;:&quot;Article&quot;,&quot;p&quot;:&quot;amp&quot;,&quot;keywordIds&quot;:&quot;world/china,world/xi-jinping,world/asia-pacific,world/world,media/media&quot;,&quot;k&quot;:&quot;china,xi-jinping,asia-pacific,world,media&quot;,&quot;co&quot;:&quot;tomphillips&quot;,&quot;bl&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;authorIds&quot;:&quot;profile/tomphillips&quot;,&quot;section&quot;:&quot;world&quot;}}" data-slot="/59666047/theguardian.com/world/Some(article)/amp">
</amp-ad>
</div>
<p>“We hope to welcome those who truly care about China’s development; who can provide objective, impartial and balanced coverage; who are truly concerned with the future direction of Chinese policy to come report on our events,” the statement said. <br></p>
<p><em>Additional reporting by Wang Zhen</em><br></p>
</div>
<div class="submeta">
<span class="submeta__label">Topics</span>
<div class="submeta__section-labels">
<ul class="submeta__links">

<a class="submeta__link" data-link-name="article section" href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/china">
China
</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="submeta__keywords">

<li class="submeta__link-item">
<a class="submeta__link" href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/xi-jinping" data-link-name="keyword: world/xi-jinping">
Xi Jinping
</a>
</li>
<li class="submeta__link-item">
<a class="submeta__link" href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/asia-pacific" data-link-name="keyword: world/asia-pacific">
Asia Pacific
</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div data-component="share" class="submeta__share">

<li class="social__item social__item--linkedin " data-link-name="linkedin">

<span class="inline-share-linkedin inline-icon rounded-icon centered-icon social-icon social-icon--linkedin">

<li class="social__item social__item--pinterest " data-link-name="pinterest">

</a>

<li class="social__item social__item--gplus " data-link-name="gplus">

<span class=' u-h '>Share on Google+</span>
<span class="inline-share-gplus inline-icon rounded-icon centered-icon social-icon social-icon--gplus">
<svg width="32" height="32" viewbox="4 -4 32 32" class="rounded-icon__svg centered-icon__svg social-icon__svg social-icon--gplus__svg inline-share-gplus__svg inline-icon__svg">
<path d="M8.8 12c-.1 2.9 2 5.7 4.7 6.6 2.6.9 5.8.2 7.5-2 1.3-1.6 1.6-3.6 1.4-5.6h-6.7v2.4h4c-.3 1.2-1.1 2.2-2.3 2.7-2.3 1-5.1-.3-5.8-2.7-.9-2.3.5-5 2.9-5.7 1.4-.5 2.9.1 4.1.8l1.8-1.8c-1.4-1.2-3.2-1.9-5-1.7-3.6.1-6.8 3.4-6.6 7zm18-3v2h-2v2h2v2h2v-2h2v-2h-2V9h-2z"/>
</svg>
</span>
</a>
</li>
<li class="social__item social__item--whatsapp " data-link-name="whatsapp">
<a class="social__action js-social__action--bottom social-icon-wrapper" data-link-name="social bottom" href="whatsapp://send?text=%22Protest%20after%20Western%20media%20&#x27;troublemakers&#x27;%20barred%20from%20Xi%20Jinping%20speech%22%20https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fworld%2F2017%2Foct%2F25%2Fprotest-after-western-media-troublemakers-barred-from-xi-jinping-speech%3FCMP%3Dshare_btn_wa" target="_blank" title="WhatsApp">
<span class=' u-h '>Share on WhatsApp</span>
<span class="inline-share-whatsapp inline-icon rounded-icon centered-icon social-icon social-icon--whatsapp">
<svg width="30" height="30" viewbox="0 0 30 30" class="rounded-icon__svg centered-icon__svg social-icon__svg social-icon--whatsapp__svg inline-share-whatsapp__svg inline-icon__svg">
<path d="M22.09 7.87a9.9 9.9 0 0 0-7.05-2.92c-5.49 0-9.96 4.47-9.96 9.96 0 1.75.46 3.47 1.33 4.98L5 25.04l5.28-1.38c1.45.79 3.09 1.21 4.76 1.21 5.49 0 9.96-4.47 9.96-9.96a9.92 9.92 0 0 0-2.91-7.04m-7.05 15.32c-1.49 0-2.95-.4-4.22-1.15l-.3-.18-3.13.82.84-3.05-.2-.31a8.19 8.19 0 0 1-1.26-4.41c0-4.56 3.71-8.27 8.28-8.27 2.21 0 4.29.86 5.85 2.43a8.222 8.222 0 0 1 2.42 5.85c0 4.56-3.72 8.27-8.28 8.27m4.54-6.2c-.25-.12-1.47-.73-1.7-.81s-.39-.12-.56.12c-.17.25-.64.81-.79.97-.14.17-.29.19-.54.06-.25-.12-1.05-.39-2-1.23a7.283 7.283 0 0 1-1.38-1.72c-.15-.25-.02-.38.11-.51.11-.11.25-.29.37-.44.12-.15.17-.25.25-.42.08-.17.04-.31-.02-.44-.06-.12-.56-1.35-.77-1.85-.2-.49-.41-.42-.56-.43-.14-.01-.31-.01-.48-.01-.17 0-.44.06-.66.31-.22.25-.87.85-.87 2.08 0 1.22.89 2.41 1.02 2.57.12.17 1.75 2.68 4.25 3.76.59.26 1.06.41 1.42.52.6.19 1.14.16 1.57.1.48-.07 1.47-.6 1.68-1.18s.21-1.08.14-1.18c-.06-.08-.23-.14-.48-.27"/>
</svg>
</span>
</a>
</li>
<li class="social__item social__item--messenger " data-link-name="messenger">
<a class="social__action js-social__action--bottom social-icon-wrapper" data-link-name="social bottom" href="fb-messenger://share?link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fworld%2F2017%2Foct%2F25%2Fprotest-after-western-media-troublemakers-barred-from-xi-jinping-speech%3FCMP%3Dshare_btn_me&amp;app_id=180444840287" target="_blank" title="Messenger">
<span class=' u-h '>Share on Messenger</span>
<span class="inline-share-messenger inline-icon rounded-icon centered-icon social-icon social-icon--messenger">
<svg width="66" height="66" viewbox="-12 -12 90 90" class="rounded-icon__svg centered-icon__svg social-icon__svg social-icon--messenger__svg inline-share-messenger__svg inline-icon__svg">
<path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M33 61.1c-3.6 0-7.1-.5-10.4-1.5L10.1 66V52.5C3.9 47 0 39.2 0 30.6 0 13.7 14.8 0 33 0s33 13.7 33 30.6c0 16.8-14.8 30.5-33 30.5zM36.5 41L28 32.2l-16.4 9 18-18.9 8.5 8.8 16.4-9-18 18.9z"/>
</svg>
</span>
</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<div class="after-article js-after-article"></div>
</div>
<div class="content__secondary-column js-secondary-column" aria-hidden="true">

</article>
</div>

<span class="inline-quote inline-icon fc-item__quote-icon">

<path d="M9.002 20c3.85.068 6.932-3.104 7-6.994.068-3.892-3.15-6.937-7-7.006-2.016-.036-3.59.694-4.888 2.053A9.968 9.968 0 0 1 4.001 6.5C4.064 2.97 7.414.937 11.003 1l-1-1C3.98 0 .098 4.447.002 10.006c-.097 5.557 3.35 9.892 9 9.994zm17 0c3.85.068 6.932-3.104 7-6.994.068-3.892-3.15-6.937-7-7.006-2.016-.036-3.59.694-4.888 2.053a9.968 9.968 0 0 1-.113-1.553c.063-3.53 3.413-5.563 7.002-5.5l-1-1c-6.022 0-9.904 4.447-10 10.006-.097 5.557 3.35 9.892 9 9.994z"/>
</svg>
</span>
{{/isComment}}
</span>
{{headline}}
</h2>
{{#isComment}}
<div class="fc-item__byline">
{{byline}}
</div>
{{/isComment}}
</div>
